Articles.Content: DTV stands for Docking Target Vehicle. This craft has two docking ports: one facing fore, the other aft, hence why it's named Janus.

I am delighted to report that the spaceflight Corax 1, with pilot Jebediah Kerman and engineer Bill Kerman, has successfully docked with the Janus DTV.

the Janus should have enough monopropellant onboard to replenish our crew's Corvus orbiter with fuel. Even without that top-off, the Janus itself has twin engines that can boost the spacecraft to a higher orbit without consuming any of the Corvus' supplies. Moreover, there's still a docking-port available, upon which another spacecraft could attach. I hear that the Corvus has some new competition. Maybe the competitors will be arriving shortly, hm?
modlist and craft file, if you please

for the Janus itself, the RCS thrusters & the probe-core are from RLA StockAlike,

the solar-panels and antenna array are from Dr. Jet's ChopShop,

and the fuel-tanks are either stock or from FuelTanksPlus.

As for the capsule docked to it in my 2nd post, I'm afraid that's from a mod that seems to be dead, namely the Corvus capsule by @Orionkermin

I've managed to find enough patches for Corvus to keep it alive, and i use it a LOT. I'm gonna miss it when a major KSP update eventually kills it.

Will upload craft file soon. Working on getting Corax 1's rival spacecraft ready for launch to dock to the Janus' other port.

Edited February 22, 2016 by StevieC
Explained why no craft file yet
This just in, folks! The competitor's spacecraft has launched, made rendezvous, and docked to the other port on the Janus DTV.
